moves.1. e4: This game is one I played on a site similar to GameKnot.  It was in the second to last round of a tournament and I needed to win or draw in order to avoid elimination.
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Ba4 Nf6: The game solidifies into the Wing Attack, which slightly favors white if played accurately
moves.6. Bb3 Be7 7. Re1 O-O 8. h3: Mostly waiting for black to commit while restricting black's potential for king side expansion
moves.8... Bb7 9. c3: Giving the white bishop an escape route and preparing to strike at the center
moves.10. d4: White goes ahead with his strike
moves.10... dxe4 11. Nxe5: This instead of 11. dxe5 to hopefully win the over-extended pawn on e4
moves.11... Bd6 12. Nxc6 Bxc6 13. Bg5: Pinning one of the defenders of that e4 pawn
moves.13... h6: Forcing white to either retreat or exchange and leave black with the bishop pair.  I decided to exchange to avoid losing the initiative
moves.14. Bxf6 Qxf6 15. d5: Forcing away the last defender of the e pawn.  In retrospect this move obstructs the white bishop and allows black's white bishop to remain active on d7 so all the focus on winning the e pawn was probably misplaced
moves.15... Bd7 16. Rxe4 Bc5: Black has some serious attacking chances here, but I was pretty sure I could defend this position.
moves.17. Qe2 Rae8:
? I think Qg6 would have been better here as this allows white to bring its knight into the fight.
I think the variation 17. ...Qg6 18. Qf3 Bf5 19. Re1 Rae8 is better
moves.18. Nd2 Qg6 19. Qf3 Rxe4: ?? Once again I think black would have been better served to force the issue with Bf5 as this allows the white knight to become even more active while gaining a tempo on the black bishop
moves.20. Nxe4 Bb6 21. Rd1 Re8 22. d6: ?? The knight on e4 is left to the mercy of black's rook
moves.22... c5: ?? Declining the knight?  Blocking the white bishop on the a2-g8 diagonal is not necessary as 22. ...Rxe4 23. Bxf7  Qxf7 Qxe4 leaves black with a winning advantage
moves.23. Bc2: Defending the knight before it is too late
moves.23... Qe6: Getting the queen away from the bishop's discovered attack.
moves.24. Qd3 c4: This appears to be a good move as it opens up the black bishop with a tempo on the queen but...
moves.25. Nf6+: ! A devastating invasion by the knight.  Black resigned here.

gameName: My first annotation so please critique
